description: From Hindi योगी (yogī), from Sanskrit योगिन् (yogin), from the verbal root yuj (class 7 present युनक्ति (yunakti, “to connect”)), from Proto-Indo-European *yugóm.

entries.meaning: (yoga) A devotee or adherent of yoga. [from 17th c.]
examples: To this day, yogins find that these disciplines, which have measurable physical and neurological effects, evoke a sense of calm, harmony and equanimity that is comparable to the effect of music.

verbs.description: yogi (third-person singular simple present yogis, present participle yogi-ing, simple past and past participle yogied)

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To turn (someone) into a yogi; to lead into practicing yoga.

description: From the cartoon character, Yogi the Bear, who was known for conning tourists out of their picnics.

verbs.description: yogi (third-person singular simple present yogis, present participle yogi-ing, simple past and past participle yogied)

entries.meaning: (US, thru-hiker slang) To persuade someone to give you food or other favors without actually begging.
